title: Personal Portfolio
short_description: A fully functional, static web portfolio developed end-to-end using only **Python** and the **Reflex** framework. Having your own portfolio website to showcase your coding skills adds a different touch
full_description: Developed a personal portfolio site to leverage a **backend-only skillset**. Utilized the open-source **Reflex** framework to achieve **full-stack development (E2E)** entirely in Python, eliminating the need for traditional HTML/CSS/JavaScript. This project successfully demonstrated rapid prototyping and efficient UI development, significantly simplifying front-end complexity.

title: Berkeley's PACMAN
short_description: AI implementation project based on the University of Berkeley's **Pacman** environment, focused on foundational search algorithms.
full_description: Implemented fundamental Artificial Intelligence algorithms within the **University of Berkeley's open-source Pacman environment**. The core task was to integrate and train agents using search strategies such as **Breadth-First Search (BFS)**, **Depth-First Search (DFS)**, and **Reinforcement Learning** to master the game. This project served as a practical application of core AI concepts.

title: GitHub Trending Visualizer
short_description: A web-based tool for **data visualization** of daily **trending open-source projects** on GitHub.
full_description: Engineered a full-stack data pipeline to **crawl** and **visualize** daily trending GitHub projects. Developed **Python crawlers** (using **Scrapy** and **BeautifulSoup**) to extract key metrics (forks, languages, companies). The collected data was served via a **Flask** backend and rendered on the frontend using the **D3.js** JavaScript library, providing a dynamic, web-based visualization.

title: Network Planning Management Tool (NPMT)
short_description: Code implementation of a network optimization research paper, focused on identifying critical network nodes for maximum disruption.
full_description: Developed a functional tool based on an ASU professor's research paper on **Network Planning Management**. The objective was to model a large-scale graph network (e.g., commercial flight routes) and implement the paper's algorithm to determine the **minimum set of critical nodes** required to disrupt the entire network. This demonstrated the ability to translate complex theoretical algorithms into executable code in **Python**.

title: American Sign Language Recognition
short_description: A machine learning project for **American Sign Language (ASL)** translation, converting gestures to text.
full_description: High-impact research project at ASU focused on developing a **User-Dependent and User-Independent ASL recognition system**. The workflow involved **data collection via sensors**, processing, gesture annotation, **feature extraction** (using **FFT** and **DWT**), and **feature selection** (using **PCA**). Machine learning models, including **Decision Trees, SVM, and Keras-based Feed Forward Neural Networks**, were trained to accurately classify 10 core ASL words. This work contributed to bridging the communication gap for the deaf community and was developed as ongoing research in 2018.

title: Benes Network Visualization and Analysis
short_description: A **Python-based visualization** and computation tool demonstrating the efficiency of calculating indices on a **Benes Network**.
full_description: Developed a **Python/Pygame** application to accompany a published research paper, which focused on network topology. The program **calculates the Transmission Index and Wiener Index** on a **Benes Network**, demonstrating a novel method that reduces the time complexity to linear or constant time. The code includes the logic to **generate a diamond-shaped Benes Network** of N dimensions.

title: Social Media Web Crawlers
short_description: Developed **web crawlers (bots)** to extract research data from various social media and review platforms for an ASU Data Mining lab.
full_description: Hired as a part-time developer for a **Data Mining research lab** during my Master's program. The primary responsibility was to design and deploy specialized **Python web crawlers** (using **Scrapy** and **BeautifulSoup**) to reliably extract data from major social media and review platforms (e.g., Goodreads, UberEats, Zomato) for subsequent academic analysis.

title: Attacks on RSA Algorithm
short_description: Implementation of several well-known and theoretical attacks to demonstrate vulnerabilities in the **RSA Cryptography Algorithm**.
full_description: Implemented multiple famous attacks against the **RSA encryption algorithm** from scratch in **C++**. This project served to understand the security foundations of the algorithm and demonstrate how various mathematical weaknesses could be exploited to compromise the system.

title: 2D Map Generation Robot
short_description: Developed a **Raspberry Pi-controlled robot** utilizing sonar sensors to autonomously generate a **2D floor map* for my final year Internet Of Things (IOT) themed project in under grad.
full_description: Designed and built a **four-wheeled miniature robot prototype** controlled by a **Raspberry Pi** chip. Motion was managed remotely via a laptop interface. The robot was integrated with **sonar sensors** to gather distance data, which was processed in real-time in **Python** to construct a **2D occupancy map** of the environment. The project's goal was mapping in hazardous or inaccessible environments.

title: Indian Missing Person
short_description: Undergraduate Capstone Project: A web-based platform for reporting, tracking, and managing records of missing persons in India.
full_description: Final Year Undergraduate Capstone Project that earned the 'Best Project Award.' Developed a comprehensive **web platform** to facilitate the reporting, management, and **tracking of missing persons** across India. The system utilized **Python** for backend logic and **Neo4J** for relationship-based data storage, with **PHP** potentially handling early web presentation components.
